name: Mitmita Butter Prawns
description: Succulent prawns pan-fried in a rich, spicy butter sauce flavored with Ethiopian mitmita and tomato paste.
keywords: Ethiopian, Prawns, Spicy, Seafood, Quick Dinner, Shellfish, Shrimp, East African Cuisine, Fusion, Butter Sauce, Mitmita Spice, 10 Minute Meal, Easy Weeknight Dinner, High Protein, Pescatarian, Pan Fried, Saut√©, Tomato Butter, Spicy Prawns, Main Course, Lunch, Gluten Free Option, Dairy

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare Sauce Base
recipeInstructions.text: Heat the frying pan over medium heat and melt the butter. Once just starting to foam, stir in the tomato paste, mitmita, and sugar. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.

recipeInstructions.name: Cook Prawns
recipeInstructions.text: Increase heat to medium-high. Add the prawns to the pan and toss to coat in the spicy butter mix. Fry for 3-4 minutes, or until the prawns are opaque and cooked through.

recipeInstructions.name: Season and Serve
recipeInstructions.text: Season with a pinch of salt to taste (mitmita often contains salt, so taste first). Serve immediately with yoghurt, lemon and fresh coriander.

notes: Mitmita can be quite spicy, adjust the amount based on your heat tolerance.
Great served with rice or flatbread for carbs.
